title: We removed QSS cancelling Death Mark, and Pink Wards countering Stealth Champs.
body:
All in the supposed name of being able to balance said Champions now that a single item doesnt invalidate them.

When are we going to remove GW and retune Healing Champions around it?

{{champion:16}} is the majority of the reason GW needs to exist. The mechanic was retuned to affect all healing instead of just self-healing specifically because of her. In my mind, she's the only one who would need such retuning anyway, since the other heal-based Champions function fine when it's not bought, and barely at all when it is.

Other heal-based Champions?

{{champion:50}} needs to be in the middle of a 5v5 teamfight for his healing to reach maximum effectiveness. That's not the safest place to be in, his healing is also DoT-styled, and can be mitigated easily by burst. Furthermore, Swain's healing is tied to his mana pool, so the easiest and safest way to beat Swain is to kite and drain his mana, which given the current state of the game isnt tremendously difficult to do.

{{champion:36}} 's main healing is on his ult, on a significant cooldown. It allows him to be more or less unkillable for a few seconds, but if he hasnt succeeded in whatever he was planning on doing when the healing is over, he's likely in a position where he'll die.

{{champion:8}} is burst heals on CDs, and his heals require fairly decent macro on the players part. His healing also hits maximum effectiveness the lower he is, which means the only way he'll escape dying is if he's that much closer to it.

{{champion:266}} every third AA. Very melee and very underwhelming.

{{champion:5}} is like Aatrox but not as underpowered.

{{champion:154}} has to step on his bloblets, which can be denied at all stages of the game and don't heal him for nearly the same amount as basically everyone above him.

GW is not a healthy mechanic, regardless of the fact that I main Vladimir. It's uninteractive, and denies stats that Champions have been balanced around being forced to function with. Imagine losing 40% of a core stat that you need because the ADC clicks on you.

_Oh._

Meh.
Make it unique passive so nobody can stack this shit.

Why it would kill the purpose of Hydra's passive? You would still get 6% out of Cleave. Besides, it's passive also makes matters worse when it comes to life steal stacking, as it gives you an AOE healing on top of the regular you already have.

When it comes to Warlord, imo, it should be removed and new mastery should be made. It's not like ad champs lack life steal options.

None of those items are healthy.  I'd argue that it's because of the tank shredding more than the grievous wounds. GW invalidates sustain champs, but LW invalidates all tanks.  I want the stat removed, but what is the difference between cutting healing in half with GW and cutting damage in half with exhaust?  There are several stats that don't really belong in the game, despite being very central to it.

The difference is Exhaust is on a massive CD and takes up an entire Summoner Spell.

If GW needs to exist, it should be on an item active that gives you a few seconds of anti-healing, but then goes on CD afterwards. LW needs to be more like Black Cleaver, so it actually facilitates the "sustained damage" niche that ADCs are supposed to be and Caitlyn can't just Headshot Crit you for 60% of your health all at once.

Making executioners have a downtime sounds like a good idea, but in the case of bonus arpen I just want it entirely removed.  It's just adc's saying that tanks can't be tanky.

Also, are you saying ignite is perfectly fine as a spell then, or is it just less of an abuse case?

Then AR items would have to be retuned, because otherwise ADCs and a good chunk of AD champs that don't have innate ways to ignore armour would be worthless. ArPen (bonus or total) does need to exist, but it's way too strong and you don't really sacrifice anything for it since you get the option of additional damage against tanks, or the effective removal of a healing-based Champ. The way an ArPen item should actually work is that every successive AA within a certain timeframe (think Jax passive) amplifies the damage of the next AA.

I think Ignite is perfectly fine. If someone used the...however long that cd is specifically to counter my healing for a few seconds, that's admirable.

Actually GW and LW don't fully negate healing or armor.

What you should be bringing up is how there's 4 different items to hard counter teemo and shaco traps.

Red trinkets, control wards and duskblade.

That's a different argument anyway. Teemo and Shaco can do things besides their traps. You can (afaik) only place one control ward at a time, and Red Trinkets have a remarkably long cd.

GW at least you can still heal, although executioner is an issue since it applies at 100% HP easily fixed by lowering HP threshold.

New LW is healthier because it's bonus armor not just total armor(Needs tweak imo though, it's pretty much a useless god item). Let me explain, it's pretty much useless until late or end game where it's a god. A soft fix would be lowering the penetration %, but while I have no ideas, feel like there's a better fix needed.

However trap disables need to dissapear and red trinket+ duskblade needs another rework. I'm find with the enemy seeing traps via control ward, but not a free item nor a passive effect.

While I do think champions like Swain, Mundo and Aatrox also tend to have really oppressive healing when it's strong, I completely agree with the core point: GW needs to go if we want to force all healing to be both healthy and balanced without the need for a counter item. The mechanic does not feel strong even if it is tremendously powerful, which is why marksmen still don't pick Mortal Reminder even against teams with heavy healing and regen, and currently no Grievous Wounds effect has any real gameplay, or anything truly interesting revolving around the denial of healing. Riot has also recently tried to slap GW onto some champions on the PBE, namely Mundo and Akali on their respective Qs, and neither worked out in the end.

Swain and Aatrox are confirmed for VGU's at some point, though I don't know if Aatrox's will be full-sized as well. I'd argue that Mundo is fine on the basis that it's his ultimate, and it can always use tweaking if it's too strong.

CD increases, higher %current health cost, or perhaps even a ramp up where for the first few seconds it's slower, but the regen really kicks into gear during the second half of the ultimate.

Fair enough, there are plenty of ways Mundo's ult could be tweaked if his healing ever gets too strong, but at the same time, it's core to how he functions in most fights. It's a long-duration effect on a pretty short cooldown, which means it's essentially designed for very high uptime, and the way he accesses it means there isn't really a way to stop his healing once it starts, other than through Grievous Wounds, which is why Ignite tends to be very important against him in top lane matchups. It doesn't really carry that much counterplay on its own, and eliminating GW from the equation means it would/should be forced to be something his opponents can respond to, instead of just one more reason to ignore him for another 12 seconds (which already happens to some extent).
They tried that didn't they? It failed miserably. I suggest kiting ADCs with your pool and Hourglass.

Vlad's ranges sit _just_ outside of the standard 550 ADC range, and almost every ADC has some kind of MS item, so there's not a lot of possible kiting.

Besides, ADC's outheal Vlad once they have BT. Crimson Rush has a minimum cd of 6 seconds, under perfect conditions. In that time, an ADC could have probably Lifesteal'd twice their health bar.

Maybe Riot should just rework BT. 20% life steal + warlords is way too high. I don't have a problem with the other life steal choices like mercurial or BotRK. DD is situational on bruisers . BT just seems like the outlier.

I reckon one of the key ways that you could make Soraka more interactive is by looking at the move Painsplit from Pokemon. It adds the HP of both Pokemon together, and redistributes it between the pokemon equally. Soraka shouldnt outright heal, she should redistribute HP from her team members + add a small heal. Tank full hp? but ADC 1 HP? When raka 1/2 HP? Take some from tank, give to raka, forward to ADC. This makes it so that poking her is the most effective way to deal with her in lane, and stops the outright full HP ADC heal spam.
I say make her Q steal health and add it to a kind of "pool" of hp that her W draws from when she heals.
In fairness, Soraka probably wouldnt be so much of an issue if Bloodthirster didnt make it feel like you had a second one healing you as well.
Something like bloodthirster runaans jinx outheals all of these champs even while hitting thornmail. GW is why its needed. Again the issue is ADCs

I find it mostly needed to deal with front lines like Mundo + Darius. They would have to be adjusted in some way. Without it they simply can't be killed in fights a lot of the time. Soraka is atleast a squishy target you can pick off first, I agree it's not a must have item just because of her.

No it wasn't just her, actually that change to not affect self healing was made specifically for her, after that failed miserably(retarded idea from the start), it was undone, but it had other problems, one of the bigger ones was that focusing the support was a lot harder, as even if you had ignite the adc would heal them to full affect, which made taking ignite bot lane a lot less effective and pushed the lane towards more passive play, it also naturally had issues with nami(try and all in nami, adc will heal her to full affect, try and focus the adc and nami will heal him to full affect, made things a lot harder than they should be), and then a bunch of lesser issues with the identity of heals vs shields(shields are basically battle heals, but that moronic change made heals a better shield), and what is to be expected from ignite(it's supposed to single out a target), it was just a horrible change overall made in an attempt to make soraka not as cancerous, which failed even at that.
On the topic of buffing champs so they don't get countered by 1 item. {{champion:90}}
If QSS didn't remove Suppression, Malzahar would be so overbearing it wouldn't be funny.

And yet buying QSS makes him completely useless. So maybe the problem isn't QSS itself but how his ult interacts with it? Remove the suppression alone? Allows them to get out of the AoE and either counter attack or break the link.
That's currently what it does. The ult itself does no damage, only places the Null Zone beneath the target while suppressing the target.

The problem right now is that GW is most effective against (read it as: it's the only counter to) adc who build lifesteal, they drain-tank more than real drain tanks while dishing out absurd burst-dps... anyway GW is not bad, it should just be made into a bruiser/tank stat, it's not fair if an adc can click on you and negate your survivability while also taking half of your hp away, it's more fair if a melee champion comes into range and fights you thouhg, since you can respond to that. Imho, GW should be moved onto Thornmail or maybe they could mkae a new item like black cleaver that, instead of shredding armor, places stacks of GW (10% reduced healing per stack).
